metadata.title: CVE-2022-41862 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In PostgreSQL, a modified, unauthenticated server can send an unterminatedstring during the establishment of Kerberos transport encryption. Incertain conditions a server can cause a libpq client to over-read andreport an error message containing uninitialized bytes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41862` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libecpg6 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpq5 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-12 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-client-12 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plperl-12 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-12 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-12 - 12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-12 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.14-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
